_header: Utter thy language with good advisement
Subjects: children, instructions for the behavior of; instruction, father to son
_description: One stanza rhyme royal, followed by four lines (lines 64-67 from Peter Idley’s Instructions [2594]) and four distichs.

BodRawC86.First Lines:
Vtter thy langage wyth gud avisementReule the by Reason in thy
                    termez all…
BodRawC86.Last Lines:
…largely to speke be wele warefor þat causeRoll faste
                    this reason & thynke wele on þis clause
BodRawC86.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             The Babees Book, etc.
EETS
         o.s. 32 (1868); rev. ed.  Early English Meals and
                Manners London: Trübner, 1876; repr. 1973: rev. ed. 219-20.
